summary: The United States Postal Service (USPS), also known as the Post Office, is a federal agency responsible for delivering mail in the U.S. and its territories. It's one of the few government agencies allowed by the U.S. Constitution. As of 2023, USPS employs over 600,000 people. It has the sole right to deliver letters, but faces competition from private companies for package delivery. USPS must provide equal service at the same price everywhere in the country.
title: United States Postal Service
